bibl.title: Frank Krebs and Pat Daughtery v. King County. Habeas Corpus Writ of Pat Daugherty
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: John F. Miller, R.M. Hopkins, Hes(unclear) Hansen

div1.p: In The Disctrict Court, Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the County of King. Habeas Corpus.

The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King County Greeting: We command you, that you have the body of Pat Daugherty by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Pat Daugherty shall be called or charged before the HON. Richard A Jones C H Hanford, Judge of the aforesaid Court at the Court Room if the Court house on the 11th day of October AD 1889 on the hour of 1 30 oclock P.M. to do abd receive what shall then and there be considered concerning him the said Pat Daugherty And you have then and there this writ. Witness the HON. Richard A. Jones C H Hanford, Judge of said District Court, and the seal therof this 10th day of October A.D. 1889. R M Hopkins Clerk. By Hes Hansen Deputy Clerk.

I do hereby return to Hon C.H. Hanford Cheif Justice of Washington Territory that before the coming to me of the within writ, the said Pat Daugherty was committed to my custody and is detained by virtue of another writ, a copy of which is here to annexed, the original of which I also herewith produced, nevertheless I have the lady of the said Pat Daugherty before you at the day and place within mentioned, as I am within communicated. Dated at Seattle the 11th day of October 1889. Sherrif Service Copy Writ Travel Return J.H.McGraw Sheriff
subscribed and from before me this 11th day of October 1889

No. 7306 In the District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle, W.T. In the Matter of the Application of Pat Daugherty and Frank Krebs for Writ of Habeas Corpus Returned and filed this 11 day of Oct. A.D. 1889 RM Hopkins Clerk. By Hes Hansen Deputy Clerk.
